summary:
I saw post about how we should get a shuri as black panther movie instead of captain marvel. 
like can we not do the antman vs...
body:
I saw post about how we should get a shuri as black panther movie instead of captain marvel.

like can we not do the antman vs Black widow thing again. I don’t want to go through that again.

Can’t we just hope we get a lady liberators film with captain marvel and Shuri working together? because I would like that.

summary: I always see people ask if billy ages and yes he does. he grows like everybody else in the dc universe.  POST FLASHPOINT AGE:...
body:
I always see people ask if billy ages and yes he does. he grows like everybody else in the dc universe.

POST FLASHPOINT AGE:

Billy was 9 when he got his powers 

Then he grew and was about 11 

Then he was 13

Later on when he joined the jsa he was 15 and was 16 in JSA#48

Finally he was 17 in Justice Society of America #23/24

NEW 52

Billy was 15 when he got his powers from the wizard

and in his upcoming series he should be about 16 or 17

summary: Can we just stop and discuss this for a moment? I’m not the only one who thinks that this is a terrible move, right? I mean,...
caption:
Can we just stop and discuss this for a moment? I’m not the only one who thinks that this is a terrible move, right? I mean, sure, I can understand wanting to remove Carol’s reliance on Mar-Vell for her origin (even if I dislike the move personally) and making her stand on her own, but like…

Now her mother’s a super powered Kree warrior. Who let her husband beat her kids. And abuse them emotionally. Because that would keep them ‘safe’.

There are so many points where she could’ve helped. Joe beating Carol and his sons. That time Carol got raped and needed help adjusting. Carol getting her memories stolen. All those times when aliens invaded and Carol was part of the last line of defense. All those times when Carol was cracking under the strain. All the stress and drama about Mar-Vell. The trouble with Moonstone.

Here we have a fully trained Kree warrior who could’ve offered a helping hand, a more understanding shoulder, lessons on how to control her wildly shifting powers, who could’ve been backup in a fight or a firm hand to intervene when Carol needed it (like when she was so drunk she nearly killed an entire plane full of people). Who could’ve taken away so much of the drama with Mar-Vell just by dropping a few words one way or the other.

Instead of stepping in when her daughter needed her the most, now we have a mother who had the power not only to save the planet on her own, who could’ve trained Carol once she became a superhero, who could’ve at least stepped in when her kids were being beaten so hard that they get panic attacks over it, just choosing to sit back and play the clueless, helpless bystander card.

reblog.comment:

Now her mother’s a super powered Kree warrior. Who let her husband beat her kids. And abuse them emotionally. Because that would keep them ‘safe’.

There are so many points where she could’ve helped. Joe beating Carol and his sons. That time Carol got raped and needed help adjusting. Carol getting her memories stolen. All those times when aliens invaded and Carol was part of the last line of defense. All those times when Carol was cracking under the strain. All the stress and drama about Mar-Vell. The trouble with Moonstone.

Here we have a fully trained Kree warrior who could’ve offered a helping hand, a more understanding shoulder, lessons on how to control her wildly shifting powers, who could’ve been backup in a fight or a firm hand to intervene when Carol needed it (like when she was so drunk she nearly killed an entire plane full of people). Who could’ve taken away so much of the drama with Mar-Vell just by dropping a few words one way or the other.

Instead of stepping in when her daughter needed her the most, now we have a mother who had the power not only to save the planet on her own, who could’ve trained Carol once she became a superhero, who could’ve at least stepped in when her kids were being beaten so hard that they get panic attacks over it, just choosing to sit back and play the clueless, helpless bystander card.

Now her mother’s a super powered Kree warrior. Who let her husband beat her kids. And abuse them emotionally. Because that would keep them ‘safe’.

There are so many points where she could’ve helped. Joe beating Carol and his sons. That time Carol got raped and needed help adjusting. Carol getting her memories stolen. All those times when aliens invaded and Carol was part of the last line of defense. All those times when Carol was cracking under the strain. All the stress and drama about Mar-Vell. The trouble with Moonstone.

Here we have a fully trained Kree warrior who could’ve offered a helping hand, a more understanding shoulder, lessons on how to control her wildly shifting powers, who could’ve been backup in a fight or a firm hand to intervene when Carol needed it (like when she was so drunk she nearly killed an entire plane full of people). Who could’ve taken away so much of the drama with Mar-Vell just by dropping a few words one way or the other.

Instead of stepping in when her daughter needed her the most, now we have a mother who had the power not only to save the planet on her own, who could’ve trained Carol once she became a superhero, who could’ve at least stepped in when her kids were being beaten so hard that they get panic attacks over it, just choosing to sit back and play the clueless, helpless bystander card.
trail.content:
Can we just stop and discuss this for a moment? I’m not the only one who thinks that this is a terrible move, right? I mean, sure, I can understand wanting to remove Carol’s reliance on Mar-Vell for her origin (even if I dislike the move personally) and making her stand on her own, but like…

Now her mother’s a super powered Kree warrior. Who let her husband beat her kids. And abuse them emotionally. Because that would keep them ‘safe’.

There are so many points where she could’ve helped. Joe beating Carol and his sons. That time Carol got raped and needed help adjusting. Carol getting her memories stolen. All those times when aliens invaded and Carol was part of the last line of defense. All those times when Carol was cracking under the strain. All the stress and drama about Mar-Vell. The trouble with Moonstone.

Here we have a fully trained Kree warrior who could’ve offered a helping hand, a more understanding shoulder, lessons on how to control her wildly shifting powers, who could’ve been backup in a fight or a firm hand to intervene when Carol needed it (like when she was so drunk she nearly killed an entire plane full of people). Who could’ve taken away so much of the drama with Mar-Vell just by dropping a few words one way or the other.

Instead of stepping in when her daughter needed her the most, now we have a mother who had the power not only to save the planet on her own, who could’ve trained Carol once she became a superhero, who could’ve at least stepped in when her kids were being beaten so hard that they get panic attacks over it, just choosing to sit back and play the clueless, helpless bystander card.
